info.title: NamSor API v2
info.description: NamSor API v2 : enpoints to process personal names (gender, cultural origin or ethnicity) in all alphabets or languages. By default, enpoints use 1 unit per name (ex. Gender), but Ethnicity classification uses 10 to 20 units per name depending on taxonomy. Use GET methods for small tests, but prefer POST methods for higher throughput (batch processing of up to 100 names at a time). Need something you can't find here? We have many more features coming soon. Let us know, we'll do our best to add it!

externalDocs.description: NamSor API client SDKs v2 for Java, Python

tags.name: Personal
tags.description: Personal names (anthroponyms) : gender, country origin/ethnicity, diaspora, US 'race'/ethniciy

get.summary: Infer the likely type of a proper noun (personal name, brand name, place name etc.)
Infer the likely country of residence of a personal full name, or one surname. Assumes names as they are in the country of residence OR the country of origin.
Infer the likely country of origin of a personal name. Assumes names as they are in the country of origin. For US, CA, AU, NZ and other melting-pots : use 'diaspora' instead.
Connects a Stripe Account.

post.summary: Create a Stripe Customer, based on a payment card token (from secure StripeJS) and email.

get.summary: Get the Stripe payment information associated with the current google auth session token.
Update the default Stripe card associated with the current google auth session token.
Get the current software version
Get the overall API counter
List possible currency options for billing (USD, EUR, GBP, ...)
Read the billing information (company name, address, phone, vat ID)

post.summary: Sets or update the billing information (company name, address, phone, vat ID)

get.summary: Read the history billing information (invoices paid via Stripe or manually).
Procure an API Key (sent via Email), based on an auth token. Keep your API Key secret.
List all available plans in the user's preferred currency.
List all available plans in the default currency (usd).
Prints the current status of the classifiers.
List of API services and usage cost in Units (default is 1=ONE Unit).
Print the taxonomy classes valid for the given classifier.
Subscribe to a give API plan, using the user's preferred or default currency.
Subscribe to a give API plan, using the user's preferred or default currency (admin only).
Remove the user account.
Remove (on behalf) a user account.
Modifies the hard/soft limit on the API plan's overages (default is 0$ soft limit).
Verifies an email, based on token sent to that email
Verifies an email, based on token sent to that email
Print basic system statistics.
Print current API usage.
Print historical API usage.
Print historical API usage (in an aggregated view, by service, by day/hour/min).
Print basic source statistics.
Add usage credits to an API Key.
Invalidate system caches.
Update debug level for a classifier
Activate/deactivate learning from a source.
Activate/deactivate anonymization for a source.
Vetting of a source.
Setting an API Key to a corporate status.

200.description: API Key set to a corporate status.

get.summary: Infer the likely type of a proper noun (personal name, brand name, place name etc.)

post.summary: Infer the likely common type of up to 100 proper nouns (personal name, brand name, place name etc.)
Infer the likely common type of up to 100 proper nouns (personal name, brand name, place name etc.)

get.summary: Infer several classifications for a cross border interaction between names (ex. remit, travel, intl com)

post.summary: Infer several classifications for up to 100 cross border interaction between names (ex. remit, travel, intl com)

requestBody.description: A list of name pairs, with country code (nameFrom -> nameTo).

200.description: A list of classified name pairs.

get.summary: Infer the likely gender of a name.
Infer the likely gender of a name, given a local context (ISO2 country code).

post.summary: Infer the likely gender of up to 100 names, each given a local context (ISO2 country code).

requestBody.description: A list of names, with country code.

post.summary: Infer the likely gender of up to 100 names, detecting automatically the cultural context.
Infer the likely gender of up to 100 fully parsed names, detecting automatically the cultural context.
Infer the likely gender of up to 100 fully parsed names, detecting automatically the cultural context.

get.summary: Infer the likely gender of a full name, given a local context (ISO2 country code).
Infer the likely gender of a full name, ex. John H. Smith

post.summary: Infer the likely gender of up to 100 full names, detecting automatically the cultural context.
Infer the likely gender of up to 100 full names, with a given cultural context (country ISO2 code).

requestBody.description: A list of personal names, with a country ISO2 code

post.summary: Infer the likely country of origin of up to 100 names, detecting automatically the cultural context.
Infer the likely country of residence of up to 100 personal full names, or surnames. Assumes names as they are in the country of residence OR the country of origin.

get.summary: Infer a US resident's likely race/ethnicity according to US Census taxonomy W_NL (white, non latino), HL (hispano latino),  A (asian, non latino), B_NL (black, non latino). Optionally add header X-OPTION-USRACEETHNICITY-TAXONOMY: USRACEETHNICITY-6CLASSES for two additional classes, AI_AN (American Indian or Alaskan Native) and PI (Pacific Islander).

200.description: a US resident's likely race/ethnicity : W_NL (white, non latino), HL (hispano latino),  A (asian, non latino), B_NL (black, non latino), AI_AN (American Indian or Alaskan Native*) and PI (Pacific Islander*). *optionally

get.summary: Infer a US resident's likely race/ethnicity according to US Census taxonomy, using (optional) ZIP5 code info. Output is W_NL (white, non latino), HL (hispano latino),  A (asian, non latino), B_NL (black, non latino). Optionally add header X-OPTION-USRACEETHNICITY-TAXONOMY: USRACEETHNICITY-6CLASSES for two additional classes, AI_AN (American Indian or Alaskan Native) and PI (Pacific Islander).

200.description: a US resident's likely race/ethnicity : W_NL (white, non latino), HL (hispano latino),  A (asian, non latino), B_NL (black, non latino), AI_AN (American Indian or Alaskan Native*) and PI (Pacific Islander*). *optionally

post.summary: Infer up-to 100 US resident's likely race/ethnicity according to US Census taxonomy. Output is W_NL (white, non latino), HL (hispano latino),  A (asian, non latino), B_NL (black, non latino). Optionally add header X-OPTION-USRACEETHNICITY-TAXONOMY: USRACEETHNICITY-6CLASSES for two additional classes, AI_AN (American Indian or Alaskan Native) and PI (Pacific Islander).

200.description: A list of US resident's likely race/ethnicity. W_NL (white, non latino), HL (hispano latino),  A (asian, non latino), B_NL (black, non latino), AI_AN (American Indian or Alaskan Native*) and PI (Pacific Islander*). *optionally

post.summary: Infer up-to 100 US resident's likely race/ethnicity according to US Census taxonomy, with (optional) ZIP code. Output is W_NL (white, non latino), HL (hispano latino),  A (asian, non latino), B_NL (black, non latino). Optionally add header X-OPTION-USRACEETHNICITY-TAXONOMY: USRACEETHNICITY-6CLASSES for two additional classes, AI_AN (American Indian or Alaskan Native) and PI (Pacific Islander).

200.description: A list of US resident's likely race/ethnicity. W_NL (white, non latino), HL (hispano latino),  A (asian, non latino), B_NL (black, non latino), AI_AN (American Indian or Alaskan Native*) and PI (Pacific Islander*). *optionally

post.summary: Infer the likely ethnicity/diaspora of up to 100 personal names, given a country of residence ISO2 code (ex. US, CA, AU, NZ etc.)

200.description: A list of diaspora / ethnicity given a name and residency.

get.summary: Infer the likely first/last name structure of a name, ex. John Smith or SMITH, John or SMITH; John. For better accuracy, provide a geographic context.

post.summary: Infer the likely first/last name structure of a name, ex. John Smith or SMITH, John or SMITH; John.
Infer the likely first/last name structure of a name, ex. John Smith or SMITH, John or SMITH; John. Giving a local context improves precision.
